{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "eb7542ba",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Fire Progression"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "aad9a80d",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "`wxee` is designed for processing weather data, but it can also be useful for remote sensing data. In this example, we'll look at how `wxee` can work with data from the GOES-R sensors to visualize fire progressions over time."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "d8a156f8",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Setup"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "id": "782cafe3",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import ee\n",
    "import wxee\n",
    "\n",
    "ee.Initialize()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "db4a5ce5",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Downloading Data to xarray"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "eea59e1d",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "GOES-16 captures 5-minute interval data including a mask with codes identifying fire hotspot detections. We'll select a time window that experienced explosive fire growth in the Western Cascades of Oregon, USA."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "0344909e",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "\u001b[1mNOAA/GOES/16/FDCC\u001b[0m\n",
      "\tImages: 288\n",
      "\tStart date: 2020-09-08 00:01:16 UTC\n",
      "\tEnd date: 2020-09-08 23:56:16 UTC\n",
      "\tMean interval: 5.00 minutes\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "ts = wxee.TimeSeries(\"NOAA/GOES/16/FDCC\").select(\"Mask\").filterDate(\"2020-09-08\", \"2020-09-09\")\n",
    "ts.describe(\"minute\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "2d82a170",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Before we go any further, we need to convert the mask codes to a binary mask of fire presence. Values 10, 11, 30, and 31 represent maximum confidence fire detections, so we'll set those pixels to 1 and all other pixels to 0 in all images."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "id": "c7095330",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def fire_mask(img):\n",
    "    mask = ee.Image(0).rename(\"fire\")\n",
    "    mask = (mask\n",
    "        .where(img.eq(10), 1)\n",
    "        .where(img.eq(11), 1)\n",
    "        .where(img.eq(30), 1)\n",
    "        .where(img.eq(31), 1)\n",
    "    )\n",
    "    # Copy the properties from the original images to avoid losing time data.\n",
    "    return mask.copyProperties(img, img.propertyNames())\n",
    "\n",
    "# Convert each mask class image into a binary fire presence mask\n",
    "fire_masks = ts.map(lambda img: fire_mask(img))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "06cf6a28",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Now we can aggregate the 288 5-minute masks to 24 hourly masks. We'll use a max reducer, meaning that an hourly hotspot was detected at least once within the hour."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "id": "b1ee5de9",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "\u001b[1mNOAA/GOES/16/FDCC\u001b[0m\n",
      "\tImages: 24\n",
      "\tStart date: 2020-09-08 00:01:16 UTC\n",
      "\tEnd date: 2020-09-08 23:01:16 UTC\n",
      "\tMean interval: 60.00 minutes\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "hourly_fire = fire_masks.aggregate_time(\"hour\", reducer=ee.Reducer.max())\n",
    "hourly_fire.describe(\"minute\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "8db05798",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Select a region around the largest fire, Beachie Creek."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "id": "6092d024",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "geom = ee.Geometry.Polygon(\n",
    "    [[[-122.77807114256022, 45.370803623985665],\n",
    "      [-122.77807114256022, 44.519360582318896],\n",
    "      [-121.46520493162272, 44.519360582318896],\n",
    "      [-121.46520493162272, 45.370803623985665]]]\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "0bb38b12",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "And download the data to an `xarray.Dataset`."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "id": "f0192d1e",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "application/vnd.jupyter.widget-view+json": {
       "model_id": "47ed6d6c08bc4d358ee731b58f228c7f",
       "version_major": 2,
       "version_minor": 0
      },
      "text/plain": [
       "Downloading collection:   0%|          | 0/24 [00:00<?, ?it/s]"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "ds = hourly_fire.wx.to_xarray(region=geom, scale=2_000, crs=\"EPSG:26910\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "169be5b6",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Progression Over Time\n",
    "Now we have 35 2D arrays representing hotspot detections in each hour. First, let's ee what those look like as a time series."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "id": "77408da3",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<xarray.plot.facetgrid.FacetGrid at 0x7f4932a936d0>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 7,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 936x576 with 25 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "ds.fire.plot(col=\"time\", size=2, col_wrap=6)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "92ec2118",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "That shows us how the fire grew over time, but maybe we want a single summary image describing that progression. Let's calculate the first hour that a given pixel burned. Rather than storing specific times, we'll represent them as time elapsed since the beginning of the time series."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "57b57546",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "First, get the start time of the time series and calculate the number of hours elapsed between each time step and the start time."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "id": "0f9295f2",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "start = ds.time.min()\n",
    "# Convert milliseconds to hours\n",
    "delta_hours = (ds.time - start) / 3_600_000_000_000"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "6bc31883",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Now, we'll multiply the delta hours by the fire mask. Because non-fire pixels have a value of 0, this will give us a 3D array with elapsed hours since start for each hotspot pixel and values of 0 for all other pixels. We cast from a `timedelta` to an `int` to allow plotting."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "id": "716fe104",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "delta_hours_fire = (ds.fire * delta_hours).astype(int)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "31e30537",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Finally, we can mask non-hotspot pixels (values of 0) and take the minimum over time to get the first time, in hours elapsed, that each pixel burned."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "id": "65a650a6",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "first_burned = delta_hours_fire.where(delta_hours_fire != 0).min(\"time\")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "39911208",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "And of course, plot it!"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 11,
   "id": "a251ed47",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<matplotlib.collections.QuadMesh at 0x7f4923f2e9a0>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 11,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 864x576 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "first_burned.plot(size=8)"
   ]
  }
 ],
